omx

Class AttributedElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • omx.AttributedElement
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OmxFile, OmxLookup, OmxMatrix

    public class AttributedElement
extends java.lang.Object
    The AttributedElement is an Open MatriX element which contains attributes. Attributes are essentially metadata which are organized as (String) key - (Object) value pairs. Note that even though there are not technical restrictions on the types of Objects the values may be, straying from basic types (numbers, Strings, lists) may cause errors when saving to OMX files.

      • setAttribute

        public void setAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.Object value)
        Set an attribute value. If this element already has an attribute corresponding to the specific key, the current attribute value will be overwritten with the new one specified in this method call.
        Parameters:

        value - The attribute value.

      • getAttributes

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getAttributes()
        Get a mapping of all attribute key-value pairs. The returned map is unmodifiable and intended to be read-only.
        Returns:
        all attributes as a key-value map.

      • hasAttribute

        Determine if this element has an attribute corresponding to a specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - The attribute key.
        Returns:
        true if this element has an attribute corresponding to key, false otherwise.

      • transferAttributes

        protected void transferAttributes(omx.hdf5.OmxMutableDataset dataset)
        Replace all of the attributes in an OmxMutableDataset with those in this element. Note that this means the following:
        1. All attribute keys in this element but not in the dataset will be added to the dataset.
        2. All attribute keys in the dataset but not in this element will be deleted from the dataset.
        3. All attribute keys in both this element and the dataset will be retained in the dataset, with the attribute value in the dataset being set to that in this element.

        Note that this method is intended to be used by implementations which need direct access to OMX HDF5 objects (most likely to read/write HDF5 files), and should not be needed/used outside of this context.

        Parameters:
        dataset - The dataset to transfer this element's attributes to.

      • transferAttributes

        protected void transferAttributes(omx.hdf5.OmxMutableGroup group)
        Replace all of the attributes in an OmxMutableGroup with those in this element. Note that this means the following:
        1. All attribute keys in this element but not in the group will be added to the group.
        2. All attribute keys in the group but not in this element will be deleted from the group.
        3. All attribute keys in both this element and the group will be retained in the group, with the attribute value in the group being set to that in this element.

        Note that this method is intended to be used by implementations which need direct access to OMX HDF5 objects (most likely to read/write HDF5 files), and should not be needed/used outside of this context.

        Parameters:
        group - The group to transfer this element's attributes to.
